ai-tha-ap150:1.1_0: “Before I wasn’t running all the time,
ai-tha-ap150:1.3_0: where the crash of the sandalwood,
ai-tha-ap150:1.4_0: taught the Kinsman of the world.
ai-tha-ap150:2.1_0: with lightness, this is the nature of the world.
ai-tha-ap150:2.4_0: and attended on by heavenly nurses;
ai-tha-ap150:3.1_0: And there are mansions and palanquins
ai-tha-ap150:3.3_0: the treasure of my valuable treasure.”
ai-tha-ap150:3.4_0: This is the fruit of the fruit.
ai-tha-ap150:4.2_0: the fruit on all the earth.
ai-tha-ap150:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap150:4.4_0: This is the fruit of the fruit.
ai-tha-ap150:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pūka.
